head.title: Girls Critically Ill After Falling in Pool

hedline.hl1: Girls Critically Ill After Falling in Pool

abstract.p: Toddlers Patricia Graca and Natalie Correia are in critical condition after falling into swimming pool in Carle Place, NY (S)

block.p: Two toddlers were fighting for their lives last night after they wandered out of a house in Carle Place on Long Island and fell into a swimming pool, the police said.

The girls, Patricia Graca, age 2 1/2, and Natalie Correia, 1 1/2, slipped out a side door of Patricia's house at 230 Rushmore Avenue at 2:30 p.m., said Officer Adele Burke, a spokeswoman for the Nassau County Police. They ended up in the pool, which is 4 feet deep and 10 feet by 20 feet, Officer Burke said.

They ended up in the pool, which is 4 feet deep and 10 feet by 20 feet, Officer Burke said.
When Patricia's mother found the girls unconscious in the pool, she screamed, and neighbors came and pulled them out, Officer Burke said. Someone performed CP.R until the ambulance arrived.
Both girls were in critical condition and on ventilators at local hospitals last night.
